body:
I recently came across the `api` keyword when using cython, but it seems that this keyword is not well documented in the docs. 
It is clearly documented how to provide basic wrappings from `cpp`-> `cython` however not the otherway around, i.e. how can a cython extension be made accessible to cpp? The `api` keywords generates `[name]_api.h' and `[name].h` however it is not entirely clear to me how to use it. 

For example:

```cython
cdef api class A [object a, type a_t]:
    def __init__(self, int a = 1):
        self.a = a
```

```cpp

#include "A.h"
#include "A_api.h"
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

int main(){
  import_A();
}

```

Fails with compilation ` g++ -I ~/miniconda3/include/python3.8 -O2 main.cpp -o test  && ./test`

comment_data.body: I think you want the `public` modifier (for linking against C/C++ code), not the `api` modifier (for sharing declarations between C implemented Python modules).
